parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of elements to return in a page. If not specified, the default is 100.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: `pageToken` is an opaque token returned by a previous call to this operation in the `nextPageToken`. If not specified, the first page of results is returned.

schema.description: `pageToken` is an opaque token returned by a previous call to this operation in the `nextPageToken`. If not specified, the first page of results is returned.

parameters.description: The start date to filter enrollments created from this date.

parameters.name: createdTo
parameters.description: The end date to filter enrollments created up to this date.

parameters.name: statusUpdatedFrom
parameters.description: The start date to filter enrollments whose status was last updated from this date. When used with statusUpdatedTo, must be earlier than statusUpdatedTo.

schema.description: The start date to filter enrollments whose status was last updated from this date. When used with statusUpdatedTo, must be earlier than statusUpdatedTo.

parameters.name: statusUpdatedTo
parameters.description: The end date to filter enrollments whose status was last updated up to this date. When used with statusUpdatedFrom, must be later than statusUpdatedFrom.

schema.description: The end date to filter enrollments whose status was last updated up to this date. When used with statusUpdatedFrom, must be later than statusUpdatedFrom.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: A filter to apply to the list of providers. Currently, name, npi, and taxId are supported. For example, `name=BDQ` will return all providers with a name that contains `BDQ`. The filter is case-insensitive.

AccessDeniedExceptionResponseContent.description: The server response for authorization failure.

name.description: The provider's name, such as `Example Dental Associates, LLC`.

id.description: The Stedi-assigned identifier for the provider.

transactions.description: The type of transactions included in the enrollment.

userEmail.description: The email address of the user submitting the enrollment. This email will be used by Stedi staff to provide updates and communicate about the enrollment's progress. It is distinct from the primary contact's email, which is used by the payer to contact the provider directly.

status.description:
The status of the enrollment. You can submit enrollments with  either `DRAFT` or `SUBMITTED` status. However, once an enrollment is set to `SUBMITTED` status, only Stedi can set or update this property.
  - `DRAFT` - You are still editing the record and it has not been submitted to Stedi.
  - `SUBMITTED` - You have successfully submitted the request and it is in Stedi's queue for review.
  - `PROVISIONING` - Stedi has begun the process of completing the enrollment with the payer.
  - `LIVE` - The enrollment process is complete, and the specified provider can begin exchanging the listed transaction types with the payer.
  - `REJECTED` - The payer rejected the enrollment. Common reasons for rejection include incorrect details in the request and that the provider is not credentialed with the payer. Customer support will contact you with reasons for rejection and next steps.
  - `CANCELED` - The enrollment has been terminated per customer or provider request.

reason.description:
Reasons why the enrollment request is still in `PROVISIONING` status, may take additional time to process, or was rejected by the payer. Only Stedi can set or update this property. 

 May contain extra required steps for processing that are specific to the payer. For example, perhaps the provider needs to log into an online portal and enter additional information before the enrollment can continue. Contact Stedi customer support with questions.

internal_note.description: Internal notes about the enrollment. Only Stedi can read, set, or update this property.

providerTransactionAccessNumber.description:
This property is required for payers that require a Provider Transaction Access Number (PTAN).

The PTAN is a Medicare-issued number given to providers upon enrollment with Medicare. This number is usually six digits and is assigned based on the type of service and the location of the provider. Upon enrollment, Medicare Administrating Contracting (MAC) providers should receive their assigned PTAN number in their approval letter.

provider.description: Information about the provider enrolling with the payer. You **must** use the [Create Provider](https://www.stedi.com/docs/api-reference/healthcare/post-enrollment-create-provider) endpoint to add the provider to Stedi before you can enroll them with one or more payers.

payer.description: Information about the payer the provider is enrolling with.

id.description: The Stedi-assigned identifier for the enrollment request.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the enrollment was created within Stedi.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the enrollment was updated.

submittedAt.description: The date and time when the enrollment was submitted. If the enrollment is in draft status, `submittedAt` is not present. When the enrollment transitions from draft to submitted, `submittedAt` will be updated to the submission time. If the enrollment was created and submitted immediately, `submittedAt` will be equal or close to `createdAt`.

statusLastUpdatedAt.description: The date and time when the enrollment status was last updated. This timestamp is used to track enrollment processing durations and enables filtering to identify recently changed enrollments. It automatically updates whenever an enrollment's status changes but remains unchanged during other updates.

transactions.description: The type of transactions included in the enrollment.

userEmail.description: The email address of the user submitting the enrollment. This email will be used by Stedi staff to provide updates and communicate about the enrollment's progress. It is distinct from the primary contact's email, which is used by the payer to contact the provider directly.

status.description:
The status of the enrollment. You can submit enrollments with  either `DRAFT` or `SUBMITTED` status. However, once an enrollment is set to `SUBMITTED` status, only Stedi can set or update this property.
  - `DRAFT` - You are still editing the record and it has not been submitted to Stedi.
  - `SUBMITTED` - You have successfully submitted the request and it is in Stedi's queue for review.
  - `PROVISIONING` - Stedi has begun the process of completing the enrollment with the payer.
  - `LIVE` - The enrollment process is complete, and the specified provider can begin exchanging the listed transaction types with the payer.
  - `REJECTED` - The payer rejected the enrollment. Common reasons for rejection include incorrect details in the request and that the provider is not credentialed with the payer. Customer support will contact you with reasons for rejection and next steps.
  - `CANCELED` - The enrollment has been terminated per customer or provider request.

reason.description:
Reasons why the enrollment request is still in `PROVISIONING` status, may take additional time to process, or was rejected by the payer. Only Stedi can set or update this property. 

 May contain extra required steps for processing that are specific to the payer. For example, perhaps the provider needs to log into an online portal and enter additional information before the enrollment can continue. Contact Stedi customer support with questions.

providerTransactionAccessNumber.description:
This property is required for payers that require a Provider Transaction Access Number (PTAN).

The PTAN is a Medicare-issued number given to providers upon enrollment with Medicare. This number is usually six digits and is assigned based on the type of service and the location of the provider. Upon enrollment, Medicare Administrating Contracting (MAC) providers should receive their assigned PTAN number in their approval letter.

provider.description: Information about the provider enrolling with the payer.

payer.description: Information about the payer the provider is enrolling with.

CreateProviderRequestContent.description: Information about the provider you want to add to your account. The provider **must** have a unique NPI from other providers in your account.

npi.description: The provider's [National Provider Identifier (NPI)](https://npiregistry.cms.hhs.gov/search). This is a 10-digit number that is unique to the provider. Note that each provider record must have a unique NPI within Stedi - you cannot create a provider with an NPI that is already in use.

taxIdType.description: The type of tax ID. Can be either an `EIN` - Employer Identification Number, or an `SSN` - Social Security Number.

taxId.description: The provider's tax ID, as specified by `taxIdType`. This identifier has to be provided without any separators, such as dashes or spaces. For example 111-22-3333 is invalid but `111223333` is valid.

name.description: The provider's business name. This is typically the provider's practice name, such as `Dental Associates, LLC`, but it can also be the provider's first and last name.

id.description: A unique identifier Stedi assigns to this provider.

createdAt.description: The date and time Stedi created the provider record.

updatedAt.description: The date and time Stedi last updated the provider record.

npi.description: The provider's [National Provider Identifier (NPI)](https://npiregistry.cms.hhs.gov/search). This is a 10-digit number that is unique to the provider. Note that each provider record must have a unique NPI within Stedi - you cannot create a provider with an NPI that is already in use.

taxIdType.description: The type of tax ID. Can be either an `EIN` - Employer Identification Number, or an `SSN` - Social Security Number.

taxId.description: The provider's tax ID, as specified by `taxIdType`. This identifier has to be provided without any separators, such as dashes or spaces. For example 111-22-3333 is invalid but `111223333` is valid.

name.description: The provider's business name. This is typically the provider's practice name, such as `Dental Associates, LLC`, but it can also be the provider's first and last name.

id.description: Deprecated. Use `idOrAlias` instead. This field will be removed in the future.

idOrAlias.description: The Payer ID. This can be the primary Payer ID, the Stedi Payer ID, or any listed aliases for the payer. Visit the [Payer Network](https://www.stedi.com/healthcare/network) for a complete list.

name.description: The payer's name, such as `Cigna` or `UnitedHealthcare`.

stediPayerId.description: The unique Stedi assigned identifier for the payer.

id.description: The Stedi-assigned identifier for the provider.

eligibilityCheck.description: Whether 270 Eligibility Checks are included in the enrollment.

claimStatus.description: Whether 276 Claim Status Requests are included in the enrollment.

professionalClaimSubmission.description: Whether 837P Professional Claims are included in the enrollment.

institutionalClaimSubmission.description: Whether 837I Institutional Claims are included in the enrollment.

dentalClaimSubmission.description: Whether 837D Dental Claims are included in the enrollment.

claimPayment.description: Whether 835 Electronic Remittance Advice (ERAs) are included in the enrollment.

solicitedClaimAttachment.description: Whether Solicited Claim Attachments are included in the enrollment.

unsolicitedClaimAttachment.description: Whether Unsolicited Claim Attachments are included in the enrollment.

EnrollmentStatus.description: The status of the enrollment. You can submit enrollments with either `DRAFT` or `SUBMITTED` status. The default is `DRAFT` if you don't include a status in the request. Once an enrollment is set to `SUBMITTED` status, only Stedi can set or update this property.

id.description: The Stedi-assigned identifier for the enrollment.

provider.description: Information about the provider enrolling with the payer.

payer.description: Information about the payer the provider is enrolling with.

transactions.description: The type of transactions included in the enrollment.

status.description:
The status of the enrollment.
  - `DRAFT` - You are still editing the record and it has not been submitted to Stedi.
  - `SUBMITTED` - You have successfully submitted the request and it is in Stedi's queue for review.
  - `PROVISIONING` - Stedi has begun the process of completing the enrollment with the payer.
  - `LIVE` - The enrollment process is complete, and the specified provider can begin exchanging the listed transaction types with the payer.
  - `REJECTED` - The payer rejected the enrollment. Common reasons for rejection include incorrect details in the request and that the provider is not credentialed with the payer. Customer support will contact you with reasons for rejection and next steps.
  - `CANCELED` - The enrollment has been terminated per customer or provider request.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the enrollment was created within Stedi.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the enrollment was updated.

submittedAt.description: The date and time when the enrollment was submitted. If the enrollment is in draft status, `submittedAt` is not present. When the enrollment transitions from draft to submitted, `submittedAt` will be updated to the submission time. If the enrollment was created and submitted immediately, `submittedAt` will be equal or close to `createdAt`.

statusLastUpdatedAt.description: The date and time when the enrollment status was last updated. This timestamp is used to track enrollment processing durations and enables filtering to identify recently changed enrollments. It automatically updates whenever an enrollment's status changes but remains unchanged during other updates.

InternalFailureExceptionResponseContent.description: The server response when an unexpected error occurred while processing request.

items.description: Details about the enrollments matching the search criteria.
Details about every provider your organization has created within Stedi.

ProviderContact.description: The contact information for the provider or the entity completing the enrollment on the provider's behalf. Either `organizationName` _or_ `firstName` and `lastName` are required. Payers may use this information to contact the provider or their representative directly regarding the status of the enrollment.

phone.description: The contact's phone number, starting with the area code and formatted with dashes as separators. For example, `555-555-5555`.

streetAddress1.description: The contact's street address, including the street number, name, and any suite or apartment number.

state.description: The contact's two-letter state abbreviation. For example, `PA`, or `MD`.

id.description: A unique identifier Stedi assigns to this provider internally.

name.description: The provider's business name. This is typically the provider's practice name, such as `Dental Associates, LLC`, but it can also be the provider's first and last name.

npi.description: The provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI). This is a 10-digit number that is unique to the provider.

taxIdType.description: The type of tax ID. Can be either an `EIN` - Employer Identification Number, or an `SSN` - Social Security Number.

taxId.description: The provider's tax ID, as specified by `taxIdType`. This identifier is formatted without any separators, such as dashes or spaces. For example 111-22-3333 is represented as `111223333`.

ValidationExceptionField.description: Describes one specific validation failure for an input member.

path.description: A JSONPointer expression to the structure member whose value failed to satisfy the modeled constraints.

message.description: A detailed description of the validation failure.

ValidationExceptionResponseContent.description:
A standard error for input validation failures.
This should be thrown by services when a member of the input structure
falls outside of the modeled or documented constraints.

message.description: A summary of the validation failure.

fieldList.description:
A list of specific failures encountered while validating the input.
A member can appear in this list more than once if it failed to satisfy multiple constraints.
